Posts.Content: I had my first radio therapy treatment on the 22nd march 14 and was not expecting to feel as rough and tired after. Has anyone else experienced this because I feel I'm imagining it Linda
Posts.Title: Radio therapy

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy and a SNB in January this year. 3 weeks of radiotherapy which finished in April I have since developed a very crusted nipple has anyone else had this thankyou kimlinda
Posts.Title: Crusted nipple

Posts.Content: Thanks Helen yes it's the same breast where the cancer was I will get checked out mind can I still contact my BCN as have not seen her since before I started treatment in April
Posts.Title: Crusted nipple

Posts.Content: Ah I'm sorry to hear you have 18 weeks of chemo I feel guilty moaning as I only have to have 3 weeks of radio therapy hope everything goes well for you your comment has helped a lot
Posts.Title: Every day stress

Posts.Content: I'm finding since I had my lumpectomy in January I get really stressed and upset easy is anyone else feeling the same
Posts.Title: Every day stress

Posts.Content: Thanks Kazey what you described is exactly how I feel I will have a look at that book
Posts.Title: Every day stress

Posts.Content: Hi anniebee23 I started with a similar rash towards end of RT and it progressively got worse spreading all over my body arms legs. I was using e45 but it was not helping so went to the doc she advised me to stop using simple soap as it causes your skin to go dry. I was prescribed hydrocortisone cream and a 3 in 1 very thick ointment that you showered moisturized etc within a few days the rash started to calm down get your self to the docs good luck
Posts.Title: RT and skin rashes

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed with breast cancer end of December2013 and had my surgery 21st January. I will be starting my radio therapy tomorrow unlike your self I did not need any further surgery once I had seen my oncologist I have waited 2 weeks for treatment to start. So you should be ok and hearing soon about yours. Any concerns ring your breast nurse Linda
Posts.Title: waiting a long time for radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi allme I'm sorry to hear that in this country we still do not support people financially when illness strikes. Your a inspiration to yourself and your children. I'm very fortunate that I receive full sick pay I cannot imagine how hard it has been for you to have to return to work so soon. I will go back to work when all treatment is finished and my employer have offered a phased return which is good you take care of your self
Posts.Title: Brave people

Posts.Content: I am in awe of how many ladies on here are looking at going back to work so soon after their operations. I've been off work since the beginning of the year I've had my operation and have just started radiotherapy. I get regular sickness meetings with my employers but mentally I just could not return to work. I'm a strong positive person but after reading some of the lovely ladies posts I think I must be weak. Just remember ladies this is one of those times in your life when you must look after your selfs good luck to you all and take care
Posts.Title: Brave people

Posts.Content: Hi Chaz I had my lumpectomy and node removal in January and I have just started my radio therapy treatment this week. Ive been on the sick since I was diagnosed in December and will not be returning to work until I'm emotionally fit this is because the nature of my job is very mentally challenging. I feel guilty being off this long but my health comes first just go with what ever you feel is best if you return to work. Good luck with everything take care Linda
Posts.Title: Start of treatment in 12 days...

Posts.Content: I feel such a wimp after reading everyone's stories of amazing courage I was diagnosed Christmas 2013 had a lumpectomy and SNB end of January and 3 weeks of radiotherapy. I'm now taking letrozole 2.5 mg for the next 5 years. I've suffered extreme fatigue and anxiety hence I'm still on the sick 7 months on I'm hoping to get back in a weeks time. I just really want to say your all very inspirational people managing to go to work whilst getting treatment
Posts.Title: Wimp

Posts.Content: Your comments mean a lot to me Helen and Andrea. Andrea I was fortunate enough not to have chemo so you take as much time off as is needed my job is emotionally demanding as I support adults with complex mental health. had I gone back any sooner I know I would not of been able to give the support these people need take care
Posts.Title: Wimp

Posts.Content: Thanks for that Wendy. I'm a residential officer supporting adults with complex challenging mental health I just hope I cope when I'm back at work but must stay positive take care Linda
Posts.Title: Wimp
